page.title: 16Wimbldon Tennis
page.content: For two weeks of the year the usually quiet suburb is crowded with tennis fanatics hoping to see some of the famous stars-John McEnroe,Jimmy Connrs, Jo Durie,Martina Navratilova-all playing for the two million prize money.This year saw the fall of the graceful Viginia Wade who first played in 1973.The local church field is turned into a busy carpark which makes around 8500 pounds during the two weeks for several charities.This year a teenager,Jacqueline Pushong,was the first ball girl ever allowed on the famous Centre Court.She was one of 22 school girls picked for the job.Also this year Wimbledon faced the problem of forged tickets.Police found 120 forgeries which were sold for 24,000 pounds.They were of a very high quality and people were easily deceived.
